body.p:
Carlisle Nicholas County
Nov. 30th 1860
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners E. H. Wilson & Noah Varner would Respectfully state that F. M. Varner, who is a son of Noah Varner & a Brother-in-law ^Nephew^ of E. H. Wilson, was taken up on a charge of Passing Counterfeit Money, & also on a charge of having Conterfeit Money in his possession in Harrison County was held to Bail in one Case in the sum of $500. & in the other in the Sum of $1000 for his personal appearance at the November Term of the Harrison Circuit Court 1860 --
Your Petitioners became his bail in Both Bonds, And at the last Term of said Court held in this month both Bonds were forfeited for the non-appearance of Said Francis M. Varner --

Your Petitioners are Citizens of Nicholas County, both in limited Circumstances & the Both have families, and the payment of said forfeited Bonds would break them up or greatly embarrass, & distress them.
In becoming bail they were moved by proper motives of towards a relation and have acted in good faith. They Pray your Excellency to remit Said Forfeited Bonds & will ever pray &c
We the undersigned Citizens ^of Nicholas County^ & neighbors of Noah Varner & E. H. Wilson would recommend to the Governor to remit the Bonds amount of the Bonds referred to in this Petition --

W. J. Stitt
Jno. A Campbell
William Norvell
